newsitem.title: GERMANY: Poland seen importing more rapeseed, products.
newsitem.headline: Poland seen importing more rapeseed, products.

text.p: Flood damage to Polish crops may boost rapeseed imports in 1997/98 (July/June) to 470,000 tonnes, compared with 370,000 in 1996/97, as well as oils and oilmeal imports, the Oil World newsletter said.
It said the country's 1997 rapeseed crop may fall to 350,000 tonnes from 461,000 tonnes last year and the 906,000-tonne annual average recorded between 1991 and 1995.
The 1997 crop would represent only 40 percent of installed domestic seed crush capacity, which had been expanded.
Poland was likely to import not only more rapeseed, but also sunseed and soybeans.
Soybean imports may rise to 115,000 tonnes in 1997/98 versus 95,000 previously, and an initial sunseed import forecast for 1997/98 of 15,000 tonnes may be too low.

Total oils and fats imports in Oct/Sept 1997/98 were forecast at 260,000 tonnes, up from 233,000 in 1996/97, of which soyoil should be 82,000 tonnes, rape oil 30,000, sun oil 66,000 and palm oil 46,000.
Oilmeal imports, mostly soymeal, were forecast to rise to 700,000 tonnes in 1997/998 from 650,000 tonnes in 1996/97.
